citation.article-title: Eight new species of the genus Micromonospora, Micromonospora citrea sp. nov., Micromonospora echinaurantiaca sp. nov., Micromonospora echinofusca sp. nov. Micromonospora fulviviridis sp. nov., Micromonospora inyonensis sp. nov., Micromonospora peucetia sp. nov., Micromonospora sagamiensis sp. nov., and Micromonospora viridifaciens sp. nov.

p.s: (in.yo’ en.sis N. L. fem. adj. inyonensis, from Inyo County, California)

Color of substrate mycelium is yellow olive (RAL 6014) on media ISP 2, red green (RAL 6013) on ISP 3, pastel copper brown (RAL 8004) on ISP 4, broom yellow (RAL 1032) on ISP 6, dahlia yellow (RAL 1032) on ISP 7 and on ISP 5 only sparse growth with colorless mycelium occurs.
A broom yellow (RAL 1032) soluble pigment is formed on medium ISP 6 and a dahlia yellow (RAL 1033) one on ISP 7.
Carbohydrate utilization pattern is indicated in Table 2.
Positive (APIZym) for esterase (C4), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, naphtol-AS-bi-phosphohydrolase, trypsin, N-acetyl-β-glucoseamidase and β-glucosidase.
Positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C8), phosphatase acid and α-glucosidase; negative for lipase (C14), α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucoronidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
Peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid; diagnostic sugars are xylose, glucose and arabinose; MK-9 (H4) is the principal menaquinone; diagnostic phospholipid is phosphatidylethanolamine.
The fatty acids are given in Table 3.
16S rRNA gene accession number is X92629.
Type strain DSM 46123T, JCM 3188T, ATCC 27600T, NBRC 13156T, NRRL 3292T.
